Investigation.name: Saturn Occultation of 28 Sagittarius (1989)
Investigation.description: On 3 July 1989 an occultation of the bright star 28 Sagittarii provided a rare opportunity for occultation observations of both Saturn and its rings with Earth-based telescopes. Prior to 1989, most of our quantitative knowledge of the optical depths and detailed radial structure in the Saturn ring system was derived from occultation experiments carried out by the Voyager spacecraft. The data acquired during this event provided important details on the state and evolution of Saturn's ring system during the period between Voyager and Cassini.
